abstract: China plans three-year trial national park project involving areas in nine provinces; Paulson Institute, Chicago-based research center studying China's environmental problems, will provide technical assistance; Henry M Paulson Jr, institute's founder, says biggest hurdle is changing China's cultural and political views to value nature, as previous Chinese conservation efforts became secondary to moneymaking ventures.
lead_paragraph: Chinese officials and an American research center have announced a plan to undertake trial national park projects in nine provinces over the next three years.

headline.main: With U.S. as a Model, China Envisions Network of National Parks
headline.print_headline: U.S. as Its Guide, China Plans a National Parks System

snippet: Chinese officials and an American research center have announced a plan to undertake trial national park projects in nine provinces over the next three years.
